task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn professional profiles for Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_1.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon in the United States. Originally from Iran, he moved to the U.S. in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. He completed his doctoral studies in Physics and Astronomy at Ohio University, focusing on the dynamics of excitable tree networks in sensory neurons. His research aimed to understand the functioning and information processing in these neurons, with applications to sensory systems like muscle spindles and pain receptors. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

After earning his Ph.D., Khaledi Nasab joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery as a postdoctoral researcher. There, he worked on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease, by designing new stimulation techniques to improve the efficacy of treatments like Coordinated Reset (CR) stimulation. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, he transitioned to a role at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. However, due to unfavorable economic conditions in 2022, CODA was unable to secure the necessary funding to advance its research to the clinical stage and had to close its doors. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Following this, Khaledi Nasab joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. His background in physics and neuroscience, combined with his expertise in machine learning and deep learning, has enabled him to contribute to Amazon's advancements in AI and network capacity planning. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Throughout his career, Khaledi Nasab has been committed to continuous learning and professional development. He dedicates time daily to reading and taking courses, aligning with Amazon's core leadership principle of "Learn and Be Curious." ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his professional work, Khaledi Nasab has been active in addressing challenges faced by international students. In 2017, he authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," discussing the impact of U.S. immigration policies on international scholars and advocating for support and inclusion within academic institutions. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Ali Khaledi Nasab's career reflects a strong dedication to scientific research, technological innovation, and advocacy for international scholars.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Ali Khaledi, Ph. D. - About

task_2.query_used: Search Google News and media archives for any mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and researcher with a focus on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. He has contributed to several publications in this field, including a 2021 paper titled "Information processing in tree networks of excitable elements" in *Physical Review E*. ([stanford.academia.edu](https://stanford.academia.edu/AliKhalediNasab?swp=tc-au-6993172&utm_source=openai))

In 2019, Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS annual meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In 2017, he was invited to give a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster, discussing "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements." ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in 2017, Khaledi Nasab authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," published in *Science*, where he shared his experiences as an international student in the United States amid changing political climates. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

More recently, in May 2023, he published an article on Medium titled "An Introduction to a Successful Job Interview," offering insights and advice based on his personal experiences. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/an-introduction-to-a-successful-job-interview-b4925c49d98?utm_source=openai))

These sources provide a comprehensive overview of Khaledi Nasab's professional achievements and personal perspectives.

task_3.query_used: Check academic databases and university websites for potential educational records or publications
task_3.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist with a diverse academic and professional background. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly focusing on sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites. His doctoral thesis, titled "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks," explored the collective behavior of these networks, relevant to sensory neurons such as muscle spindles and electroreceptors. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

During his doctoral studies, Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

After completing his Ph.D., he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery as a research scientist, collaborating with Peter Tass on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. Their work focused on coordinated reset stimulation techniques to modulate neural network activity. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, Khaledi Nasab co-authored a paper titled "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation," published in Frontiers in Physiology. This research investigated the effects of random reset stimulation on neural network desynchronization, contributing to the understanding of neural plasticity and potential therapeutic applications. ([med.stanford.edu](https://med.stanford.edu/tass-lab/publications.html?utm_source=openai))

In 2022, he joined Amazon as a research scientist, focusing on machine learning and artificial intelligence applications. His expertise spans nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He is passionate about leveraging his knowledge to shape the future, serve customers, create new products, and deepen our understanding of complex systems. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Khaledi Nasab has also been active in sharing his experiences and insights through various platforms, including Medium, where he reflects on topics such as career development and personal growth. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai))

For a comprehensive overview of his publications and contributions, you can visit his Google Scholar profile. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

judgement.revised_report:
# Ali Khaledi Nasab - Professional Profile

## Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian-American physicist and AI scientist currently working as a research scientist at Amazon Web Services (AWS). With a Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University, he has built a career spanning neuroscience research, gene therapy development, and artificial intelligence applications.

## Educational Background
- **Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy** - Ohio University (completed circa 2019)
  - Research focus: Dynamics of excitable tree networks in sensory neurons
  - Applications to sensory systems including muscle spindles and pain receptors¹
  - Received American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award (2019)²

## Career Timeline

### Academic Research (2014-2021)
- **2014**: Moved from Iran to the United States to pursue doctoral studies¹
- **2017**: Invited colloquium speaker at College of Wooster - "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements"³
- **2019**: Completed Ph.D. at Ohio University
- **Post-2019**: Postdoctoral Researcher at Stanford University, Department of Neurosurgery
  - Developed stimulation methods for neurological disorders including Parkinson's disease
  - Focused on improving Coordinated Reset (CR) stimulation techniques⁴

### Industry Experience (2021-Present)
- **2021-2022**: Research position at CODA Biotherapeutics
  - Gene therapy startup focused on epilepsy treatments
  - Company closed in 2022 due to inability to secure clinical-stage funding⁵
- **2022-Present**: Research Scientist at Amazon (AWS Network Capacity Team)
  - Applies physics and neuroscience background to AI and network capacity planning⁵

## Research Contributions
- Published in *Physical Review E* (2021): "Information processing in tree networks of excitable elements"⁶
- Additional publications in *Frontiers in Physiology*⁷
- Google Scholar profile indicates ongoing research activity⁷

## Professional Activities & Recognition
- 2019 APS Student Travel Award recipient²
- Active in addressing international student challenges
- 2017: Authored "Standing up to fear" in *Science*, discussing U.S. immigration policy impacts on international scholars⁸
- 2023: Published career advice on Medium: "An Introduction to a Successful Job Interview"⁹

## Personal Philosophy
- Committed to continuous learning, dedicating daily time to reading and courses
- Aligns with Amazon's "Learn and Be Curious" leadership principle⁵

## Verification Notes
- No professional certifications or registrations found in public databases
- No legal proceedings or court records identified
- Limited social media presence (no public profiles found on major platforms)
- Personal website: alikhaledi.com

---
### Citations
¹ ohio-forum.com - APS Travel Award announcement  
² ohio-forum.com - 2019 APS conference attendance  
³ ohio-forum.com - 2017 Wooster colloquium  
⁴ alikhaledi.com/about - Stanford research details  
⁵ alikhaledi.com - Career timeline and Amazon role  
⁶ stanford.academia.edu - Publication record  
⁷ scholar.google.com - Research profile  
⁸ academia.edu - "Standing up to fear" article  
⁹ ali-khaledi1989.medium.com - Career advice publication

Throughout his career, Khaledi Nasab has been committed to continuous learning and professional development.
